title: Text Page, Cover Sheet for "Fuochi d'Artifico (Bozetto)" ["Sketch for 'Fireworks"], from "Progetti Scenici per 'Sintesi Futuriste'" Portfolio, ca. 1980 reproduction of 1915–1925 original
title_raw: Cover Sheet for "Fuochi d'Artifico (Bozetto)" ["Sketch for 'Fireworks"], from "Progetti Scenici per 'Sintesi Futuriste'" Portfolio
markings: Watermark repeated horizontally across top and bottom edges: Ingres Fabriano
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower right corner:  Luce Balla/Elica Balla
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower right corner, :  45/150
description:
Title page of first plate with print technique, dimensions, print edition and printer at upper right; below is authorization for this porfolio of reproductions of Balla's original prints/drawings at lower right.  It includes a table of contents of the 9 prints in the portfolio:  1. Fuochi d'Artifico, Bozzetto [Design for Fireworks]
2. Fuochi d'Artifico, Particolare [Fireworks, Detail]
3. Sintesei Primavera, Bozzetto Completo [Set Design for Spring Syntheses]
4. Sintesi di Primavera, Donna Albero [Lady Tree, Spring Syntheses]
5. Sintesi di Primavera, Donna Cielo [Lady Sky, Spring Syntheses]
6. Sintesi di Primavera, Angelo [Angel, Spring Syntheses]
7. Tipografia Scenario [Typographic Scenery]
8. Tipografia, Studio di Costume [Typographic Costume Study]
9. Studio per Balletto [Study for a Ballet]
This list is followed by information on the plates; the original works and related documentation were donated by Luce and Elica Balla to La Scala Theater Museum, Milan, followed by statement that each print is accompanied by this authorization and is numbered.

tombstone.epitaph:
Text Page, Cover Sheet for "Fuochi d'Artifico (Bozetto)" ["Sketch for 'Fireworks"], from "Progetti Scenici per 'Sintesi Futuriste'" Portfolio, ca. 1980 reproduction of 1915–1925 original. Letterpress on cream laid paper. 
Gift of Tamar Cohen. 1999-6-5-5
